title: Corporate HR Department Is Wall Street's Next Battleground
summary: Investment banks, stung by declines in securities-trading and principal investments, are jockeying for the reliable revenue that comes from managing employee-benefit programs. The hottest new client on Wall Street: corporate human-resources managers.

title: Activision Blizzard to Cut Staff in Broad Restructuring
summary: Company also plans to boost number of developers to ramp up new content for its biggest videogame franchises. Activision Blizzard Inc. said it plans to cut about 8% of its workforce as it grapples with changes in how people buy and play videogames.

title: Suddenly, Bezos Is Media's Hero
summary: Once more, the press manufactures a 'narrative' in advance of the facts.. I set out to write a column three weeks ago about what Jeff Bezos' divorce might mean for Amazon, but was pulled up short by an unanswered question. Was his new girlfriend, Lauren Sanchez, responsible for leaking the text messages and photos that found their way to the National Enquirer? Applying Occam's razor, it was the likeliest explanation. If so, Mr. Bezos' judgment about whom to trust might be a legitimate worry for investors. But since I had no evidence on this point and didn't feel like speculating at Ms. Sanchez's expense, I dropped the subject.

title: Medicare for All Is a Trap
summary: If Democrats back single-payer health care, it could assure Trump's re-election.. A political party is asking for trouble when it embraces a position on a high-profile issue that most Americans oppose. But it isn't easy to avoid this pitfall when a majority of the party's own members endorse that position. As the campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination heats up, the Medicare for All plan first proposed by Sen. Bernie Sanders risks pushing candidates into this trap.

title: The Supreme Court Isn't Anti-Muslim
summary: It erred in denying a death-row inmate's request for an imam-but not out of bias.. Alabama put Domineque Ray to death last week after the U.S. Supreme Court refused his petition to have an imam beside him as he died. State officials had denied that request because of security concerns. They said he could pray with the imam immediately before the execution, but only prison employees, including a Christian chaplain, were permitted to enter the chamber.

title: N.Y. Lawmakers Scrutinize Amazon, Tesla Deals at Hearing
summary: State Sen. John Liu questioned whether the incentives were necessary to secure the headquarters. New York's economic development chief acknowledged Tuesday that there have been complications with two major projects that Gov. Andrew Cuomo has touted in his efforts to build a high-tech economy.

title: 'The Empire and the Five Kings' Review: The Desert Grows
summary: A leading French intellectual laments the decline of the West and the rise of Russia, China, Turkey, Iran and Sunni radical Islamism.. Bernard-Henri Lévy is one of France's leading public intellectuals-a philosopher, activist and documentary filmmaker, and the author of some 30 short, sharp, topical books. His latest, released not long after his 70th birthday (and now translated by Steven B. Kennedy), sums up his long career as a bridger of worlds-what we can now call, without fear of exaggeration, the old world and the new. It testifies to the yawning chasm that's developed between these worlds, and raises doubts over whether it can ever be bridged.

title: Democrats and Anti-Semitism
summary: The problem isn't 'tropes' that are 'hurtful.' It's policies that aim to wipe out the only Jewish nation.. The Democrats have an anti-Semitism problem, and it isn't subtle. Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar tweeted Sunday that congressional support for Israel is "all about the Benjamins baby," a slang term for $100 bills-a straightforward accusation that American lawmakers who support the Jewish state are being bought off. Who does she think is paying American politicians to be pro-Israel, the Forward's opinion editor asked. "AIPAC!" Ms. Omar gleefully replied, notwithstanding that the American Israel Public Affairs Committee does not contribute to political campaigns.

title: Trump's Wall Crumbles Under the Law of Diminishing Returns
summary: The president needs to avoid the sunk-cost fallacy and take what he can get on border security.. In economics, the law of diminishing returns describes the shrinking benefits associated with additional capital expenditures. Beyond some point, the disadvantages of increasing your investment start to outweigh the advantages. Alas, there is a political corollary to this concept that the White House has been ignoring but maybe shouldn't.

title: He Has a Purple Heart, but the VA Wouldn't Call Him a Veteran
summary: Because he left the service with 'bad paper,' Alejandro Garcia was denied benefits for almost nine years.. The Department of Veterans Affairs often moves at a glacial pace. Stories of delayed disability claims and long wait lists for treatment are legion. What has gone unnoticed, however, is that thousands of former U.S. service members wait an average of four years before they can even get in the long lines for benefits or health care. What's the holdup? Service members with less-than-honorable discharges must wait for the VA to decide formally whether they are veterans.

title: Dissecting the College Scandal
summary: Should youthful mistakes-even offensive ones-be held against politicians later in life?. Editor's note: In this Future View, students write about how politicians should be judged for mistakes they made in college. Next we ask, "Is the campus free-speech crisis overblown?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Feb. 19. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Minister's Resignation Turns Up Heat on Canada's Trudeau
summary: Prime Minister faces ethics probe into whether his aides sought to head off prosecution of Montreal firm. OTTAWA-A political firestorm threatened to engulf Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who is gearing up for a tough re-election bid, after Tuesday's resignation of the minister at the center of a growing scandal.

title: Hedge Fund Co-Founder Gets 30 Months for Role in Alleged Bribery Scheme
summary: Huberfeld pleaded guilty last year to conspiracy to commit wire fraud. The co-founder of defunct hedge fund Platinum Partners was sentenced to 30 months in prison for what federal prosecutors said was his role in a scheme to bribe the former head of New York City's jail officers union.

title: Amazon Slashed Prices at Whole Foods; Now They're Going Up
summary: Online retail giant feels pressure from suppliers facing higher costs. Whole Foods is raising prices again, bowing to pressure from some consumer-product makers to cover rising packaging, ingredient and transportation costs on hundreds of products.

summary: Two council members are proposing bills that would limit brokers' fees and security deposits. Two New York City Council members will introduce a package of bills on Wednesday that aim to make renting apartments more affordable.

summary: At Tuesday's cabinet meeting, another call for expanded legal migration.. Today brought more news of a historically tight job market, as businesses have continued to respond to President Trump's tax and regulatory reforms by going on a hiring binge. The problem is that they can't find enough workers. Fortunately, today also brought more comments from President Trump suggesting that he knows how to fix it.

title: Border Deal Doesn't Resolve Detention Questions
summary: Republican and Democratic lawmakers cite different immigration detention numbers. summary: Investors have become somewhat more optimistic following the resumption of trade talks this week. The U.S. dollar weakened as investors are cautiously optimistic about ongoing trade talks between the U.S. and China.

summary: Juan Guaidó called for caravans to pressure the military to allow deliveries of humanitarian aid to Venezuelans on Feb. 23 to help ease a humanitarian crisis. The new leader of Google's cloud-computing business plans to dramatically expand its sales team, addressing one of the biggest challenges he faces as rivals Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp. race ahead in the market.

summary: Investor sentiment was also buoyed by a tentative agreement that would avoid another U.S. government shutdown. summary: The conglomerate will invest more than $1 million in Girls Who Code. summary: CONTENT FROM OUR SPONSOR. Iron-ore miner Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. on Tuesday named a new chief financial officer, nabbing the finance chief of metals service center Metals USA Holdings Corp.

summary: Number of available jobs exceeds unemployed Americans by 1 million at end of 2018, according to the Labor Department. The number of job openings in the U.S. rose in December to the highest level since 2000.

summary: Higher stock prices, new corporate-bond sales divert investors. U.S. government bond prices pulled back Tuesday as demand was blunted by rising stock prices and new corporate-bond sales.

title: Molson Coors Hit by Decline in Drinking
summary: Brewer of Coors Light and Miller Lite said it would boost marketing to younger-adult drinkers. Molson Coors Brewing Co. said it would spend more to draw young adults to its beers as the brewer tries to combat weaker sales in North America due to declining rates of drinking.

title: California Trims Its High-Speed Rail Ambitions
summary: After delays and cost overruns, Gov. Gavin Newsom says it isn't realistic anymore to connect San Francisco and Los Angeles. SAN FRANCISCO-California Gov. Gavin Newsom is scaling back the state's decade-old plan to build a high-speed rail line connecting its major cities in the north and south.

title: Oil Ticks Higher on Easing Demand Fears, Falling OPEC Output
summary: Hopes that trade tensions between the U.S. and China will ease also provide support to crude prices. • Oil prices rose alongside stocks and other commodities Tuesday, boosted by improved appetite for risk assets by a potential deal in Washington to avoid another partial government shutdown this week and optimism about a U.S.-China trade agreement.

title: Santander Bond Move Unnerves Bank-Debt Investors
summary: Spanish lender raises questions with unusual move in risky part of debt market. Spanish lender Banco Santander SA said Tuesday it wouldn't redeem a risky kind of bank debt, a move analysts said could ripple across a largely untested corner of the bond market.

summary: U.S. currency's unexpected durability poses increasing risks for American multinationals. A stubbornly strong dollar is looming over a rebound in U.S. stocks, weighing on companies' profits and stoking worries of slowing U.S. growth.

summary: Venezuelan bonds were among the best performers before the sanctions. The U.S. Treasury Department released guidance in an attempt to clarify confusion over trading in the Venezuelan bond market that has resulted in the wake of new sanctions.

summary: Owens-Illinois asks for a court order canceling pledge of Citgo stock. A U.S. company trying to collect $500 million from Venezuela after the firm's glassmaking plants were nationalized is laying claim to the country's refiner Citgo Petroleum Corp.

title: Defined-Contribution Plans Surpass Half of Pension Assets, Report Finds
summary: Employers continue their steady move to defined-contribution retirement plans like 401(k)s. Defined-contribution retirement plans accounted for more than half of total pension assets last year in the seven countries with the largest share of these assets, according to a report from consulting firm Willis Towers Watson.

title: Fed Chief Says Economic Expansion Has Been Uneven
summary: Powell says strong economy 'has not been felt as much in some areas,' addresses policies for reducing inequality. ITTA BENA, Miss.-Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said Tuesday, during a visit to Mississippi, that the economic expansion hasn't been evenly shared in many parts of the country, particularly in rural America.

title: JAB Looks to Boost Stake in Coty With $1.75 Billion Offer to Buy Shares
summary: Purchase of 150 million Coty shares at $11.65 a share is a 21% premium to Monday's close and would boost JAB's stake to 60% from 40%. JAB Ltd. has offered to significantly boost its stake in Coty Inc. by buying up to $1.75 billion in shares, a move intended to signal its confidence in the embattled beauty giant.

title: El Chapo Verdict in U.S. Closes a Chapter for Mexico
summary: Violence-troubled nation will shift focus from arresting cartel leaders to reducing violent crime. MEXICO CITY-The conviction of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán Loera concludes an important chapter in Mexico's own war on drugs, in which the military, with the help of American law enforcement, targeted top cartel leaders for capture and often extradition to the U.S.

title: The Weak Spot in the Oil Market That Traders Are Missing
summary: Some analysts believe faltering demand in Germany, not China, poses bigger risk to global crude market. Oil traders focused on China's crude demand may be overlooking a less conspicuous problem elsewhere.

title: Schumer, Sanders, Socialism and Buybacks
summary: Sens. Schumer and Sanders's signal on corporate buybacks is more about helping Democrats win elections next year than about corporate decision-making.. Holman Jenkins makes light of the latest Democratic proposal from Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and Sen. Bernie Sanders to improve capitalism by putting constraints on corporate share buybacks that allegedly enrich executives and shareholders at the expense of workers and communities ("Ignore My Socialism, Please!," Business World, Feb. 6). Mr. Jenkins considers the Schumer-Sanders cure for "short-termism" in corporate America to be another silly-season signal to the Democratic base. That signal is more about helping Democrats win elections next year than about corporate decision-making. If Democrats do gain more power, their ability to tamper with capitalism will, as always, be constrained by interest-group pressures and subsequent election considerations.

title: Trump's Metal Tariffs Are Saving U.S. Industries
summary: Commerce secretary Wilbur Ross disputes a Wall Street Journal editorial.. Your Feb. 4 editorial "Steel Tariff Profiteers" cherry picks data and ignores key facts. For one, you use the February-November time frame to calculate the increase in employment, even though the tariffs were not fully implemented until later. You cite a loss of 100 jobs in the steel industry during that period, but if you instead cite the March-November time frame, there is instead an increase of 1,000 jobs according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Book Value Isn't Everything In Selecting a Value Fund
summary: The assets' value depends on their ability to generate future cash, not on what somebody once paid for them.. I always enjoy Mark Hulbert's investing columns and "Want to Invest in a True 'Value' Fund? Good Luck" (Journal Report, Feb. 4) is no exception. But I do think investors must be cautious about using book value as a benchmark. With most companies it's based on relatively ancient transactions that often undervalue the company's assets (though they can overvalue them for companies in dying businesses). Microsoft, for instance, trades at over 10 times its book value. The assets' value depends on their ability to generate future cash, not on what somebody once paid for them. The major exception is financial companies, most of whose assets are frequently revalued to reflect current market conditions. Thus financial-company stock prices should hew much closer to book value than those of other industries.

title: Spanking Children Is Never A Good Way to Discipline
summary: What you teach with spanking is that hitting is an option. It should be no surprise that we have violent behavior in schools as the theory of appropriate physical punishment continues.. Regarding Robert C. Hamilton's "The Right Way to Spank a Child" (op-ed, Feb. 6): How long will we continue to accept the ridiculous notion that there is an appropriate time and method to spank a child? Dr. Hamilton would have us believe that corporal punishment occurs after careful, deliberate thought, but it usually happens in a moment of frustration and anger. The child is left feeling helpless, angry and confused. Who hasn't seen a child in the grocery store swatted in the head by an adult who probably weighs at least 100 pounds more? What you teach with spanking is that hitting is an option. It should be no surprise that we have violent behavior in schools as the theory of appropriate physical punishment continues.

title: Survey Says ... Avoid Emerging Markets
summary: A Bank of America Merrill Lynch fund-manager survey calls emerging markets the most crowded trade. Investing isn't a popularity contest.

title: Netflix for News: Publishers Chafe at Apple's Terms

summary: Investors were largely eyeing stories with consequences that go beyond the metals sector. Copper futures fell for the fourth session in a row on Tuesday, relinquishing some more of the gains of recent weeks as investors awaited further macroeconomic news.

summary: In its golden-anniversary year, the Museum at FIT distills 33 of the shows mounted over its lifetime into a heady selection of influential and innovative garments and accessories.. New York

summary: On his most upbeat album yet, the ever-evolving country/Americana artist features appealingly varied acoustic tunes and a level of self-comfort that marks a new phase in his music..

title: Hawaii's Big Island By Bike: A Heart-Racing, Spectacularly Scenic Trip
summary: Once the lava rocks stopped flying, a determined cyclist set out-with little more than a credit card-on a five-day journey to circle Hawaii's largest isle. HERE'S WHAT happened in 2018: My wife and I built a house in Hawaii and I brought my bicycle from New York with the intent of circumnavigating the Big Island. Then, for 125 straight days from May to September, Kilauea Volcano spilled and shot lava from two dozen fissures, covering 13.7 square miles of land and more than 700 homes, while filling the air with vog (volcanic smog) and the roads with lava rocks and ash. I put the ride on hold.

title: A Day in the Life of Xia Ding, the JD.com Exec and Formidable Fashion Force
summary: "Fashion is half art, half science.". As president of international fashion at JD.com , one of China's biggest online retailers, Xia Ding has a unique view into the evolving tastes of uber-wealthy Chinese shoppers. "It [used to be] about logo, logo, logo; big name, big name, big name," says Ding, 48, on a recent chilly morning in Shanghai. "Now people can easily wear a T-shirt from Zara holding an LV bag." JD.com, backed by the likes of Google and Walmart , was originally known for peddling quality electronics at a time when China was awash in counterfeit goods. But two years ago, Ding was brought on to transform the decidedly unglamorous e-commerce giant, which reported $55.7 billion in revenue in 2017, into a competitive online emporium.

title: Tracking Xia Ding
summary: A day in the life of the JD.com exec. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Apple Loses Ground to Huawei in China
summary: iPhone shipments were down 20% from a year earlier in the last three months of 2018; local leader Huawei's were up 23%. HONG KONG-iPhone shipments in China slumped far more than overall smartphone shipments there last quarter, costing Apple Inc. further ground against local rival Huawei Technologies Co. in the world's biggest smartphone market.

title: Nissan Rebuffed French Push for Renault Merger
summary: The Japanese car maker wanted a bigger stake in Renault. PARIS-The French government held talks with Nissan Motor Co. in early 2018 about the possibility of a full-blown merger with Renault SA, but the Japanese auto maker countered with proposals to strengthen its hand within their existing partnership, according to a person familiar with the deliberations.

title: Three Things to Think About if You Fear a Slowdown
summary: Investors are finding it difficult to form a global outlook. Stock prices and the economy have diverged, and that makes it even harder than usual to judge whether there is a true global slowdown under way.

title: In Germany, a Cold War Deal to Host U.S. Nuclear Weapons Is in Question
summary: Debate about U.S. nuclear weapons in Germany flares up for the first time since the 1980s. BERLIN-German Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling partners are reconsidering their support for a decadesold arrangement that puts Germany under the U.S. nuclear shield, a development that could further undermine the country's already-tense relationship with the Trump administration.

title: The NBA's Best Team Has a Human Yoga Mat
summary: Resume Subscription. Among the NBA players this season who have dared to launch the most long 3-pointers are Stephen Curry, James Harden and someone with the proper reaction to the sound of his name in the same breath as Curry and Harden's.

title: Nissan Counts the Costs of Ghosn
summary: A profit warning from the Japanese car giant underlines the need to reset its alliance with Renault. Is the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi auto alliance unraveling? Investors should watch how long it takes for Nissan to replace disgraced ex-chairman Carlos Ghosn.

title: Barr Helped CIA Navigate Rocky Times With Congress
summary: Barr will once again find himself caught between a struggling department and angry lawmakers. WASHINGTON-Long before he was tapped by President Trump to be attorney general, William Barr helped the Central Intelligence Agency navigate one of the most turbulent periods in its history.

title: OPEC Production Falls Significantly on Saudi Output Cuts
summary: The oil cartel is fulfilling its pledge to mop up excess global oil supply through coordinated cuts. LONDON-OPEC significantly reduced its crude-oil production in January, making good on its latest deal to curb output and rebalance an oversupplied market, the oil cartel said Tuesday.

title: Trial of Catalan Separatists Pushes Spain Closer to Snap Elections
summary: Pro-independence parties warn they will withhold vital support for the prime minister over lack of progress over Catalonia. MADRID-The return of tensions over Catalan separatism is threatening to bring an early end to the government of Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez.

title: North Korea Keeps Stockpiling Materials to Make Nuclear Weapons, Report Finds
summary: Finding is a reminder of Pyongyang's ability to increase its nuclear arsenal should diplomacy falter. SEOUL-North Korea has kept producing raw materials needed to make nuclear weapons, though the threat has subsided since 2017 as the country's suspension of missile tests has halted its progress on delivery systems capable of hitting the U.S. mainland, according to a new report.

title: Gucci Still Looks Nouveau Riche to Investors
summary: The brand's parent company Kering had a better 2018 than rival LVMH, but shareholders aren't convinced it will last. Gucci is a huge hit with millennials, but investors are proving a tough sell.

title: A Painful New Year for Chinese Bonds
summary: Resume Subscription. It's New Year's in China but there's been no fresh start for the country's onshore bond market. Early data suggest defaults are accelerating this year after a big rise in 2018, while two big private issuers have had trouble servicing debts in recent days. The case of one of those-financial conglomerate China Minsheng Investment-illustrates how tricky investing in Chinese bonds can be.

title: China's Developers Go on Borrowing Spree
summary: As the Fed strikes a more dovish tone, junk-rated property firms sell dollar-denominated debt. Chinese property companies with junk credit ratings have rushed to sell dollar-denominated debt, in their busiest start to a year on record.

title: A Year After Parkland: Making Sure to Say, 'I Love You' at Morning Drop-Off
summary: Anger sometimes flares in community; one family's coping includes counseling, hours at the piano, college in Ireland. PARKLAND, Fla.-The horror of the shooting here nearly a year ago that left 17 people dead crosses Ina Berlingeri-Vincenty's mind every morning when she drops her son Nico off at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

title: U.S. Seeks Accountability for Former Saudi Aide in Khashoggi Killing
summary: Riyadh has resisted U.S. pressure to take decisive action against Saud al-Qahtani, who Washington has sanctioned in the case. A top Saudi official who was fired after being accused of playing a role in the killing of dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi continues to serve as an informal royal adviser, and the U.S. is pressing the kingdom behind the scenes to hold him accountable, according to U.S. and Saudi officials.

title: Trump and Beto O'Rourke Stage Dueling Rallies Near Border
summary: President calls for wall in scorching address; Democrat appeals for unity, sees 'nothing to be afraid of'. President Trump and former Texas Rep. Beto O'Rourke faced off in head-to-head rallies Monday night, staging a political battle 1,000 feet from the southern border in El Paso, Texas.

title: Writer Sues Twitter Over Ban for Criticizing Transgender People
summary: Canadian blogger tweeted 'Men aren't women,' violating harassment rules on the platform. title: Lawmakers Agree in Principle to Fund Border Security
summary: Lawmakers have been negotiating agreement to fund government through September. WASHINGTON-Senior lawmakers said Monday night they had reached an agreement in principle on a sweeping deal to end a monthslong fight over border security and avoid a partial government shutdown this weekend.

title: Democrats Face Great Opportunity-and High Peril
summary: Party risks that perceptions of extremism or stridency could alienate the center. Democrats have arrived at a moment of great opportunity, but also of great peril.

title: Mexico Seeks to Revise Private Pipeline Contracts
summary: President López Obrador, criticizing privatization of energy sector, says state-owned electric utility is being forced to pay even when it isn't receiving fuel. MEXICO CITY-President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said the Mexican government wants to revise natural-gas pipeline contracts with private companies under which the state-owned electric utility is paying even when it hasn't received fuel.

title: Amazon to Acquire Home Wi-Fi Company Eero
summary: Deal gives Amazon access to technology making devices easier to connect with Alexa. Amazon.com Inc. on Monday disclosed its latest bet to control the so-called smart home, adding to its fold a company that offers a Wi-Fi system that ditches the traditional router.

title: New York City's Sandy Rebuilding Program Was Plagued From the Start, Study Says
summary: More than half of the roughly 20,000 people who registered for assistance left the Build It Back program. A multibillion-dollar New York City program to rebuild homes damaged in superstorm Sandy was so poorly run that more than half of the roughly 20,000 people who signed up for assistance dropped out, a new study shows.

title: Vote on the Green New Deal
summary: Every Member of Congress should step up and be counted.. Democrats rolled out their Green New Deal last week, and by all means let's have a national debate and then a vote in Congress-as soon as possible. Here in one package is what the political left really means when it says Americans need to do something urgently about climate change, so let's see who has the courage of those convictions.

title: DoorDash Reaches for More Than $6 Billion Valuation in New Funding
summary: The company is arming itself with more private capital as rivals Uber and Postmates are planning IPOs. Food-delivery startup DoorDash Inc. is arming itself with new funding as two of its rivals prepare for initial public offerings.

title: FDA Challenges Supplement Makers' Marketing Claims
summary: Agency accuses 17 companies of illegally selling products as treatments for diseases including Alzheimer's. The Food and Drug Administration on Monday accused 17 nutritional-supplement makers of selling more than 58 products with improper claims that they can prevent, treat or cure serious diseases, including Alzheimer's.

title: De Blasio Rejects Congestion Pricing Plan, But Leaves Door Open
summary: New York mayor cited conditions for his support, including hardship exemptions and more money for mass transit in the city. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio told state lawmakers on Monday that he was unable to support Gov. Andrew Cuomo's current congestion pricing proposal but that with certain adjustments he might.

title: Andrew Cuomo's Tears of SALT
summary: He wants Donald Trump to repeal one of tax reform's best features.. Spare a thought this week for the beleaguered underclass known as Albany politicians. New York Gov. Let's hope the President doesn't fall for it.

title: The Education of Ilhan Omar
summary: Democratic leaders rebuke their anti-Israel freshman colleague.. The Democratic Party's support for Israel has been fraying for years, and some new Members of Congress seem willing to indulge in arguments that border on the anti-Semitic. So kudos to House Democratic leaders who slapped down one of their own, freshman Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar, for her ugly comments.

title: Illinois Attorney General Pushes for Tougher Sentence in Police Shooting
summary: Petition asks the state's high court to base sentence in the Laquan McDonald killing on 16 counts of aggravated battery. title: Morgan Stanley, in Biggest Deal Since Crisis, Courts Future Millionaires
